title: I Have a New Argument for Moral Realism, and I Want Your Feedback
description:
I have a request for you. If you like philosophy, then help me tear down the argument I just wrote so I can build it back stronger. 

Normal video-quality will return with the next video, which will be released in a few weeks. 

Thanks everyone for your patience!

title: Does Proving God Exists Leave Room for Faith?
description:
Does proving God's existence leave room for faith? In this video, I answer a common objection to the project of proving God's existence, and show how a correct understanding of faith shows that faith is not hindered, but helped, by rational arguments for God. 

This video is part of a larger series on the existence of God. Subscribe for more content like this!

Have questions? I can be reached at thomascahillquestions@gmail.com.

description:

title: How Aristotle Came to Believe in God
description:
Did you know that one of the most important pre-Christian philosophers who ever lived believed in something remarkably similar to the God of Christianity? Find out why in this video. 

For a fuller treatment of this topic, check out my Substack post on this question: https://philosophyofcommonsense.substack.com/p/aristotle-change-and-classical-theism. 

Have questions? I can be reached at thomascahillquestions@gmail.com.

title: A New Way to Prove God Exists
description:
In this video I explain one of Dr. Edward Feser's arguments for God from his book "Five Proofs of the Existence of God," the "Rationalist Proof." I propose this argument as a stronger version of the argument from contingency, and show why it is uniquely immune to certain objections against that family of arguments.

description:
This video explains Catholic theologian Thomas Aquinas' most distinctive argument for God, the Argument from Essence and Existence. 

Have questions? You can reach me at thomascahillquestions@gmail.com.

title: The Argument for God from Morality Explained
description:
In this video I explain one of the most popular arguments for the existence of God, the Argument from Morality.

Got Questions? I can be reached at thomascahillquestions@gmail.com.

title: Aristotle's Argument for God Explained
description:
This video explains one of the most important arguments for the existence of God, Aristotle's Argument from Motion.

Got Questions? I can be reached at thomascahillquestions@gmail.com.

title: Anselm's Ontological Argument for the Existence of God Explained
description:
This video summarizes Anselm's Ontological Argument for God's existence, and explains why the very definition of God might proof that God must exist.

Have questions? You can reach me at thomascahillquestions@gmail.com.

title: Why You Should Love Your Country (And What That Looks Like)
description:
In this video I give my thoughts on why being patriotic is a good thing, and what that looks like practically.

Have questions? You can reach me at thomascahillquestions@gmail.com.

title: Why Richard Dawkins Is Wrong About The Afterlife
description:
In this video I discuss Richard Dawkin's claim that the materiality of the intellect prevents an realistic hope for an afterlife, and demonstrate how we can know that the intellect is immaterial and that an afterlife is therefore possible. 

Have questions? You can reach me at thomascahillquestions@gmail.com.

title: Is Plato Right?
description:
In this video I ask a question that's been on my mind – is it possible to philosophically explain the reality of universals without accepting Platonism?

Have questions? You can reach me at thomascahillquestions@gmail.com.

title: Same-Sex Marriage is a Fiction. Here's Why.
description:
In this video I explain how the common understanding of same-sex marriage as a legal reality forgets that the notion of same-sex marriage contains a logical contradiction.

Have questions? You can reach me at thomascahillquestions@gmail.com.

title: Why Alex O'Connor Is Wrong About Free Will
description:
In this video I respond to a 2017 video by Alex O'Conner (The Cosmic Skeptic) against free will (link below). I discuss how our moral intuitions point to a universal assumption of free will, and how that universal assumption raises the bar for disproving free will to a point O'Conner can't clear. 

O'Connor's Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OwaXqep-bpk

Have questions? You can reach me at thomascahillquestions@gmail.com.
